p: COVID-19 is a serious human infectious disease of global concern. As of 7 April 2020, SARS-CoV-2 has infected a total of 134,784 patients globally at least ( Figure 3D & G). The COVID-19 outbreak poses a serious challenge to China and the whole world; it has profoundly affected public health. Although the overall mortality rate of SARS-CoV-2 appears to be lower than that of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV ( Table 1), the transmissibility of COVID-19 is more rapid. Moreover, the fatality rate of elderly patients with reduced immunity or chronic diseases is as high as 15% [ 6]. In addition, asymptomatic carriers may be a potential source of infection, sustaining a local epidemic and global spread [ 83]. Therefore, COVID-19 may cause disruptions to the global public health system for an extended period of time.
